item.title: Converting The US To Electric Vehicles: Priceless
item.description: A non-scientific, but clearly well thought-out back-of-envelope calculation by MIT CS professor Philip Greenspun is food for thought: the cost of replacing the entire fleet of U.S. passenger cars with electric ones would be zero. Here are some of his numbers: * total spent per year: $1 trillion * percentage of oil consumed by passenger cars: 40 * total spent per year on oil for passenger cars: $400 billion [refining into gasoline, distributing, and retailing add even more to this]
